name: Borgo Egnazia

reviews.text: We chose Borgo Egnazia based on the beautiful pictures and readers reviews. We were not disappointed!
reviews.title: An idyllic hideaway in the olive groves of Puglia !!

reviews.text: We arrived in Bari, and hired a car. A tip for fellow drivers, you must put San Domenico Golf Resort into the Sat Nav as we put the hotel name and it didnt work. Lucky we had a few instructions from out travel agent.
reviews.title: Puglian pleasure

reviews.text: We arrived at the Hotel and were very pleased with the whole look of the hotel. Just like the brochure pics.
reviews.title: Serene Apulian luxury

reviews.text: Check in was smooth and the staff are friendly. We didnt speak any Italian (our own fault) but there was sometimes confusion as some staff dont speak good English. Definately take a phrase book !!
reviews.title: Unbelievable Hotel

reviews.text: We booked a room (La Corte Splendida) in the main part of the hotel which is named La Corte, which we were advised to do as it is central to all restaurants and the 2 main pools.The room was beautiful and was quite large with a lovely couch area, desk and a balcony with small table and 2 chairs on it. We overlooked the 2 pools which was lovely. I think this is the first category to have both shower & bath, some rooms only have shower. Separate toilet and lovely toiletries. The room has everything you could want for , including free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Bellissimo!
Lovely but
reviews.text: Nice surroundings. Food was fine. Lovely pool and spa Area where it is located does does not have a lot to do. Hotel gets very few Americans . Golf course is the best in the area. Expected a bit better service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two years ago and adored everything about it. The hotel is still magnificent and perfectly maintained with great facilities. But the dining rooms are extremely disappointing. Food and service seem perfunctory, and don't match the extremely high prices. Better food can be found in almost any family run restaurant in Italy.
reviews.title: It has lost its soul

reviews.text: I was excited to go to this hotel as I love Italy but I was very disappointed and miserable as the service and food was very disappointing. To get a cup of coffee or tea in the morning took at least 10 minutes and then it always arrived cold. One day I asked for a cup of coffee mid morning, it had still not arrived 10 minutes later so I gave up. The food was also terrible so upsetting as Italy has such wonderful food. The hotel looked beautiful, lovely decor but the staff need to be trained and they definitely need more staff employed. The one good thing was the kids club that was excellent and was very well run.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I definitely would not go back there.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: Our stay at Borgo Egnazia was exceptional. Very fine and sober taste in every detail of the hotel. Notwithstanding the fact that the hotel website displays images of the different swimming pools they are worth commenting as they are in real life as wonderful as they look on the website. Beach included with all the necessary amenities. It is a place to relax and let the hotel staff pamper you. We were particularly satisfied by the unconditional assistance received from the local advisor team. They assisted us with splendid results in findings from classical concerts at nearby locations to a diverse sample of exquisite local restaurants from different cities. Breakfast was delicious and is served in a beautiful dinning area. The only place for improvement we believe to be the pizza served in one of the restaurants. We believe that the quality was not worthy of an italian restaurant. We wish to be back to the hotel many times including a visit with more family and friends so we can be able to enjoy one of the villas accommodation.
reviews.title: Perfetto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 7 night stay at The Borgo Egnazia. We stayed in the main hotel - La Corte Bella, It was beautiful and very relaxing. The whole complex is amazing, a photographers dream!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel, Excellent Food & Service

reviews.text: The service was second to none, everyone in the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Ooooer, but it's not all bad news...

reviews.text: Special thanks to Francesco, one of the restaurant managers who was very efficient, friendly and helpful advising my husband with his gluten free diet. Also Kirren, who showed us around the hotel and village on our arrival.
reviews.title: Lovely setting, but next time I will try elsewhere

reviews.text: I cannot praise the friendly staff enough, they all went out of there way to be helpful.
reviews.title: Fabulous place, but don't come here for the food...

reviews.text: We will certainly return again to this beautiful hotel!
reviews.title: Lovely place but could do better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in June. It was superb. Friendly staff, excellent facilities (gym was fine and had a/c, which was needed). Really good, proper pools which were just the right temperature and good enough to do some proper lengths.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Sunbeds always available. Lovely rooms - we had a Splendida and it was one of the best hotel rooms I've stayed in. Good service. Quick (hired) bike ride to the beach and there is a separate little resort area here as well, with sun loungers and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Not just a hotel; an experience

reviews.text: Food was good, but Restaurant Camini is over-priced for what it is, and the Frasca outdoor restaurant is very nice but limited (pizza and a few other dishes but you'd soon get bored) and there is little in-between in-resort, but we had a fantastic open-air buffet at Masseria Cimino one night, with locally sourced foods and five courses. That was lovely.
reviews.title: Stunning stylish retreat with service flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely 5-star. Will be going again.
reviews.title: Luxury in Puglia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at this resort surpassed all our expectations. Having stayed at many luxury hotels around the world, this is by far at the top of my experiences. From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave, the staff are incredible. They are considerate and genuine with a love of Puglia and amazing knowledge of the area. Any request is not a problem. The staff will go out of their way to ensure your stay is amazing. The children's pool and club is just amazing, with caring staff who the children adore. We were shocked at how wonderful they were with our kids. Breakfast is beautiful and diverse, yet traditional. This was my second stay at the resort, the first on business and this time with two children under 6. I will make sure that i return here whenever I am in puglia or even Italy. I couldn't recommend this resort highly enough. It is very special.
reviews.title: A dream honeymoon...

aka: Borgo Egnazia Villas Hotel Golf Puglia
description: The main hotel will feature 63 guest rooms and suites; a variety of restaurants and bars; two outdoor and one indoor swimming pool; a grand ballroom and several meeting rooms; plus a 2,000 m² Raison d’Etre spa, designed to be one of the best in Europe, featuring a modern-day interpretation of a Roman bath house. The 28 villas represent the most exclusive accommodation at the Resort; each with three bedrooms, a private garden and a swimming pool, wrap-around balconies and roof terraces. The most spectacular part of the Resort will be the Village inspired by the nearby hillside towns. L’hotel si compone di 183 sistemazioni tra le camere e suite dell’albergo, letownhouse del borgo e le ville private. Tutte le camere, suite, townhouse e villecosteggiano a nord le rovine dell’antica città d’Egnazia, mentre a sud il pittorescovillaggio di Savelletri, il tutto circondato da meravigliosi alberi d’ulivo – alcuni deiquali tra i più secolari al mondo.
